item.description:
Hello,

Due to the forecasted blizzard and heavy snow accumulation, we are rescheduling the Nickerson hike for Saturday, February 9, 2013 to Saturday March 2nd.  We hope to see you at that date, but if you are not able to attend, please change your RSVP.


Stay safe and stay warm.  See you on the trails soon.

Thank You,

Amy Wilmot - South Region Interpretive Coordinator

Bill Vickstrom - hike leader Friends of Myles Standish

This hike is the first in the Five-Park Hiking Challenge.

Join Amy Wilmot, a DCR interpreter and myself on a 5-mile hike in Nickerson State Park. We will share some interesting information and discuss unique features of each park along the way. The hike will visit four ponds and loop around three of them. We'll travel along some nice beach areas and also have some great elevated hillside views of the ponds.

Meet at the parking lot across from Camping Area #1 at 9:45. Hike will start promply at 10:00AM. The hike is for adults who can walk at a moderate pace. Bring water, a lunch and bug spray for ticks. Well-behaved dogs are welcome on an 8-foot or shorter leash (no expandable leashes please) Traction devices are recommended for the few hilly areas if there is snow or ice. Pre-registration is required to keep a safe group size. Pre-register at (508) 866-2580 x161. We will hike rain or shine. If weather conditions are severe, call for cancellation update

Directions:

Nickerson State Park is located in southeastern Massachusetts on the mid-Cape, Brewster.
From Boston: take Rte. 3 south to the Sagamore Bridge, then Rte. 6 to exit 12 in Orleans, turn left off the ramp onto Rte. 6A West towards Brewster. Continue for about 2 miles. Park Entrance is on left.

Other hikes we have planned:

Saturday, March 16th Massasoit State Park, Taunton

Saturday, April 13th F. Gilbert Hills State Forest, Foxboro

Saturday, May 18th Wompatuck State Park, Hingham

Saturday, June 1st Borderland State Park, Easton
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the parking lot across from Camping Area 1 on Deer Park Road - 3/4 mile in on Right.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: RESCHEDULED: DCR / Friends of Myles Standish Five Park Hiking Challenge
